messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Just got Back from the Library

messages.messageBody:
Glad you liked it! (I'm happy to e-mail a chapter to anyone who asks.)

David

NumoAstro@... wrote:

> David I loved the chapter you sent me and I will certainly include this on
> the list of books for the library. I'll let you all know what she said and
> which ones she added. I guess it does only take one person to make a
> difference.
>
> Dawn F

--
"And the Skylark Sings with Me" is to homeschooling what Tom Paine's "Common
Sense" was to the American Revolution."--Greg Bates, Common Courage Press. To
read a sample chapter or the foreword, and to get information about ordering a
signed copy, visit www.skylarksings.com or send an e-mail to
shantinik@...

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Just got Back from the Library
messages.msgSnippet: David I loved the chapter you sent me and I will certainly include this on the list of books for the library.  I ll let you all know what she said and which
messages.messageBody:
David I loved the chapter you sent me and I will certainly include this on
the list of books for the library. I'll let you all know what she said and
which ones she added. I guess it does only take one person to make a
difference.

Dawn F

messages.msgSnippet: Hi Bridget ... I agree ... Dr. Raymond and Dorothy Moore s book, *Better Late than Early* is great, too :) ... From:  To:
messages.messageBody:
Hi Bridget ...

I agree ... Dr. Raymond and Dorothy Moore's book, *Better Late than Early*
is great, too :)

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Just got Back from the Library
messages.msgSnippet: ... Nancy Wallace s Child s Work: Taking Children s Choices Seriously is my favorite. Also, John Taylor Gatto s Dumbing Us Down Linda Dobson s The Art of
messages.messageBody:
NumoAstro@... wrote:

> Hi All:
>
> Need some input... I went to my library this morning and talked to the Branch
> Manager who was wonderful.. I told her there were no books on unschooling
> and 7 on homeschooling and she asked me if I could suggest some. She said
> they had plenty of money in their budget for those books. I quickly whipped
> out my copy of The Unschooling Handbook and she ordered it from Amazon.com as
> we were talking. She asked me if there were anymore I could recommend. I
> could only think of the Colfax's book and didn't know if that was unschooling
> or homeschooling. Anyway she ordered that.
>
> I told her about the unschooling loop and she asked me to ask you for
> recommendations of unschooling books. She is more than willing to buy
> several more books if I can give her the names and authors...

Nancy Wallace's "Child's Work: Taking Children's Choices Seriously" is my
favorite.

Also, John Taylor Gatto's "Dumbing Us Down"

Linda Dobson's "The Art of Education",

and, if I'll be so bold, my own (as below).

david

>
>
> So please let me have the names of books that you guys would recommend for
> people who are insterested in unschooling.
>
> Dawn F.

--
"And the Skylark Sings with Me" is to homeschooling what Tom Paine's "Common
Sense" was to the American Revolution."--Greg Bates, Common Courage Press. To
read a sample chapter or the foreword, and to get information about ordering a
signed copy, visit www.skylarksings.com or send an e-mail to
shantinik@...
